page.title: 02Boroma Questionaire Report
page.content: On Thursday, a day in June, we interviewed the Chairman of the Henley-Boroma Link Committee. The idea for a link with a 3rd world town was first thought of by the Chairman, Mr. Alun Jones, when a person called Max Lazu told Britain that a lot more help could be given to a town in need if a prosperous town in Britain would twin with them. The link was established in 1981, but the idea came in 1980, when Max Lazu gave his talk. Although the Chairman has not been over to Boroma himself, several people in the Committee have been over, including Joanna Sheppard, an ex-reporter/photgrapher for the Henley Standard, also a founder member, and Derrick Gilbert, the Vice Chairman.
